thread.title: Asia Pacific: Winners Named in 2nd Annual MTV Project Aloft Music Competition
thread.title_full: Asia Pacific: Winners Named in 2nd Annual MTV Project Aloft Music Competition

author: Michael Taylor
title: Asia Pacific: Winners Named in 2nd Annual MTV Project Aloft Music Competition
text:
Asia Pacific: Winners Named in 2nd Annual MTV Project Aloft Music Competition 
Entertainment 
Musical groups from China, India, and Thailand have been named winners in the Project Aloft Star Amplified by MTV contest , which supports emerging musical talents in the Asia Pacific. Michael Taylor (centre) with Pandabros, 2014 winners the China section of the Project Aloft Star competition in the lobby of Aloft Guangzhou University Park in Guangzhou, China, in December 2014. Photo Credit: Accidental Travel Writer. 
Project Aloft Star, Amplified by MTV, aims to identify and supoprt the hottest emerging musical talents in the Asia Pacific. Musicians compete in 3 clusters: China, India, and Southeast Asia, which includes Malaysia, Singapore, and Thailand. 
Drawing more than 350 entries, the competition was launched on 22 May 2015. More than half a million votes were received on line. 
A joint venture between Aloft Hotels and MTV, Project Aloft Star is a global initiative aimed at identifying and giving a platform to up and coming musicians. 
A key element of the competition is that the aspiring musical talents have not yet signed a recording contract. 
Launched in June 2014, the initiative received 300 submissions in 3 clusters across Asia in its first year, when more than 170,000 votes were received. 
Finalists in this year's contest battled it out in September 2015 at Aloft Hotels in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia; Bangalore, India; and Guangzhou, China, performing in front of a panel of judges, who judged them on the following criteria ... Music composition and song-writing skills; Originality and creativity; Technical skill, “wow” factor, and showmanship, and ... Stage presence. 
Each winner will receive a cash prize of US$10,000 and will be featured on MTV Seen, which will air on MTV Asia, MTV China, and MTV India in October 2015. 
The winners will also be featured in individual vignettes on the Project Aloft Star website. And the Winners Are ... 
For China Judge Charles Chan, Project Aloft Star 2015 China Winner Gusian Yu, Mindy Li and MTV VJ Yangyang at Aloft Guangzhou University Park in Guangzhou, China. Photo Credit: Aloft. 
For India Judge Clinton Cerejo with Project Aloft Star 2015 India Winner Run Pussy Run members Anjo John, Gowri Jayakumar, Bobin James (MTV Indies), Abhishek Debsikdar (Run Pussy Run), and Hazel Ooi (Starwood Hotels & Resorts Asia Pacific) at Aloft Bengaluru Cessna Business Park in Bengalore, India. Photo Credit: Aloft. 
For Southeast Asia Judges Vincent Ong and Paras Sharma with Project Aloft Star 2015 Southeast Asia Winner Jenny & The Scallywags from Thailand at the Aloft Kuala Lumpur Sentral in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia . Photo Credit: Aloft. 
Loft Hotels are members of the Starwood Hotels and Resorts Worldwide group. 
There are currently 100 Aloft Hotels now open in 15 countries around the world. Trendy and well wired, the hotels are targeted at connected young tech-savvy world travellers. 
Talking Points 
What do you think of a hotel group sponsoring a music competition like this?
